reference.title: Connecting a LAN-based shared Translation Memory

section.title: Purpose
section.indexterm: connectingOTMBATCH: Translation Memory databases (from command area)
section.p: If you want to connect a shared Translation Memory, using a command typed in your system’s command area instead of windows might be quicker and more convenient.

refsyn.title: Format
refsyn.p: The following syntax diagram describes how you connect a shared Translation Memory with the OTMBATCH command. Note that lowercase letters in a parameter name are optional and need not be typed.

section.title: Parameters

plentry.pd: CONNECT specifies that you want to connect a shared Translation Memory.
Specifies the drive where the shared Translation Memory can be found.
Specifies the name of the Translation Memory that you want to connect.

If you specify the parameter in this format, you are not prompted with any message window. If you do not specify any of the /quiet paramaters, a message window pops up whenever an error occurs or when the task has successfully completed.
If you specify this parameter, you are not prompted with any message window. Any error message text is routed to stdout.

section.note: You can type the commands in uppercase, lowercase, or in mixed-case letters. You may not use any wildcard characters, such as an asterisk (*).
